page.title: 03HOLYDEAN CASTLE
page.content: Holydean Castle is one of the Border Reiver castles.It was the home of the Ker family who are the ancestors of the Duke of Roxburghe. There are small parts of the castle which are still standing.The largest remaining part is the bake house with its arched ceiling.Legend has it that there is a tunnel leading from the bakehouse to the hanging tree which stood in a field a mile away.No traces of the tunnel have been found and the hanging tree is no longer there. There also remains the main entrance archway of the castle with its walls 2 feet 6 inches wide.As well as the archway,there is an old well and a turret wall overgrown with ivy. An old chapel and Deer Park are no longer there.
